word: How deeply grieved the Saviour is by the loss of one of the souls for whom He made so great a sacrifice. He would bring all into the kingdom of heaven. He desires all to see the King in His beauty. . . . Let us not keep looking at the defects of others. Let us look ever to Jesus. . . . There are sinners to be saved, and in word and deed we are to fulfill Christ's purpose for them, as His agencies of healing. . . .
